t: John 8
Jesus*p went unto the mount of Olives.
And*p early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.
And*p the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,
They*p say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
Now*p Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?
This*p they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground, as though he heard them not.
So*p when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He*r that*r is*r without*r sin*r among*r you,*r let*r him*r first*r cast*r a*r stone*r at*r her.*r
And*p again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.
And*p they which heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, even unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
When*p Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman,*r where*r are*r those*r thine*r accusers?*r hath*r no*r man*r condemned*r thee?*r
She*p said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither*r do*r I*r condemn*r thee:*r go,*r and*r sin*r no*r more.*r

Then*p spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I*r am*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world:*r he*r that*r followeth*r me*r shall*r not*r walk*r in*r darkness,*r but*r shall*r have*r the*r light*r of*r life.*r
The*p Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.

Jesus*p answered and said unto them, Though*r I*r bear*r record*r of*r myself,*r yet*r my*r record*r is*r true:*r for*r I*r know*r whence*r I*r came,*r and*r whither*r I*r go;*r but*r ye*r cannot*r tell*r whence*r I*r come,*r and*r whither*r I*r go.*r
Ye*rp judge*r after*r the*r flesh;*r I*r judge*r no*r man.*r
And*rp yet*r if*r I*r judge,*r my*r judgment*r is*r true:*r for*r I*r am*r not*r alone,*r but*r I*r and*r the*r Father*r that*r sent*r me.*r
It*rp is*r also*r written*r in*r your*r law,*r that*r the*r testimony*r of*r two*r men*r is*r true.*r
I*rp am*r one*r that*r bear*r witness*r of*r myself,*r and*r the*r Father*r that*r sent*r me*r beareth*r witness*r of*r me.*r
Then*p said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye*r neither*r know*r me,*r nor*r my*r Father:*r if*r ye*r had*r known*r me,*r ye*r should*r have*r known*r my*r Father*r also.*r
These*p words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.
Then*p said Jesus again unto them, I*r go*r my*r way,*r and*r ye*r shall*r seek*r me,*r and*r shall*r die*r in*r your*r sins:*r whither*r I*r go,*r ye*r cannot*r come.*r
Then*p said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither*r I*r go,*r ye*r cannot*r come.*r
And*p he said unto them, Ye*r are*r from*r beneath;*r I*r am*r from*r above:*r ye*r are*r of*r this*r world;*r I*r am*r not*r of*r this*r world.*r
I*rp said*r therefore*r unto*r you,*r that*r ye*r shall*r die*r in*r your*r sins:*r for*r if*r ye*r believe*r not*r that*r I*r am*r he,*r ye*r shall*r die*r in*r your*r sins.*r
Then*p said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even*r the*r same*r that*r I*r said*r unto*r you*r from*r the*r beginning.*r

I*rp have*r many*r things*r to*r say*r and*r to*r judge*r of*r you:*r but*r he*r that*r sent*r me*r is*r true;*r and*r I*r speak*r to*r the*r world*r those*r things*r which*r I*r have*r heard*r of*r him.*r
They*p understood not that he spake to them of the Father.

Then*p said Jesus unto them, When*r ye*r have*r lifted*r up*r the*r Son*r of*r man,*r then*r shall*r ye*r know*r that*r I*r am*r he,*r and*r that*r I*r do*r nothing*r of*r myself;*r but*r as*r my*r Father*r hath*r taught*r me,*r I*r speak*r these*r things.*r
And*rp he*r that*r sent*r me*r is*r with*r me:*r the*r Father*r hath*r not*r left*r me*r alone;*r for*r I*r do*r always*r those*r things*r that*r please*r him.*r
As*p he spake these words, many believed on him.
Then*p said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If*r ye*r continue*r in*r my*r word,*r then*r are*r ye*r my*r disciples*r indeed;*r
And*rp ye*r shall*r know*r the*r truth,*r and*r the*r truth*r shall*r make*r you*r free.*r
They*p answered him, We be Abraham's seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye*r shall*r be*r made*r free?*r
Jesus*p answered them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Whosoever*r committeth*r sin*r is*r the*r servant*r of*r sin.*r
And*rp the*r servant*r abideth*r not*r in*r the*r house*r for*r ever:*r but*r the*r Son*r abideth*r ever.*r
If*rp the*r Son*r therefore*r shall*r make*r you*r free,*r ye*r shall*r be*r free*r indeed.*r
I*rp know*r that*r ye*r are*r Abraham's*r seed;*r but*r ye*r seek*r to*r kill*r me,*r because*r my*r word*r hath*r no*r place*r in*r you.*r
I*rp speak*r that*r which*r I*r have*r seen*r with*r my*r Father:*r and*r ye*r do*r that*r which*r ye*r have*r seen*r with*r your*r father.*r
They*p answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If*r ye*r were*r Abraham's*r children,*r ye*r would*r do*r the*r works*r of*r Abraham.*r
But*rp now*r ye*r seek*r to*r kill*r me,*r a*r man*r that*r hath*r told*r you*r the*r truth,*r which*r I*r have*r heard*r of*r God:*r this*r did*r not*r Abraham.*r
Ye*rp do*r the*r deeds*r of*r your*r father.*r Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.

Jesus*p said unto them, If*r God*r were*r your*r Father,*r ye*r would*r love*r me:*r for*r I*r proceeded*r forth*r and*r came*r from*r God;*r neither*r came*r I*r of*r myself,*r but*r he*r sent*r me.*r
Why*rp do*r ye*r not*r understand*r my*r speech?*r even*r because*r ye*r cannot*r hear*r my*r word.*r

Ye*rp are*r of*r your*r father*r the*r devil,*r and*r the*r lusts*r of*r your*r father*r ye*r will*r do.*r He*r was*r a*r murderer*r from*r the*r beginning,*r and*r abode*r not*r in*r the*r truth,*r because*r there*r is*r no*r truth*r in*r him.*r When*r he*r speaketh*r a*r lie,*r he*r speaketh*r of*r his*r own:*r for*r he*r is*r a*r liar,*r and*r the*r father*r of*r it.*r
And*rp because*r I*r tell*r you*r the*r truth,*r ye*r believe*r me*r not.*r
Which*rp of*r you*r convinceth*r me*r of*r sin?*r And*r if*r I*r say*r the*r truth,*r why*r do*r ye*r not*r believe*r me?*r
He*rp that*r is*r of*r God*r heareth*r God's*r words:*r ye*r therefore*r hear*r them*r not,*r because*r ye*r are*r not*r of*r God.*r
Then*p answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?
Jesus*p answered, I*r have*r not*r a*r devil;*r but*r I*r honour*r my*r Father,*r and*r ye*r do*r dishonour*r me.*r
And*rp I*r seek*r not*r mine*r own*r glory:*r there*r is*r one*r that*r seeketh*r and*r judgeth.*r
Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r If*r a*r man*r keep*r my*r saying,*r he*r shall*r never*r see*r death.*r
Then*p said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If*r a*r man*r keep*r my*r saying,*r he*r shall*r never*r taste*r of*r death.*r
Art*p thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?
Jesus*p answered, If*r I*r honour*r myself,*r my*r honour*r is*r nothing:*r it*r is*r my*r Father*r that*r honoureth*r me;*r of*r whom*r ye*r say,*r that*r he*r is*r your*r God:*r

Yet*rp ye*r have*r not*r known*r him;*r but*r I*r know*r him:*r and*r if*r I*r should*r say,*r I*r know*r him*r not,*r I*r shall*r be*r a*r liar*r like*r unto*r you:*r but*r I*r know*r him,*r and*r keep*r his*r saying.*r
Your*rp father*r Abraham*r rejoiced*r to*r see*r my*r day:*r and*r he*r saw*r it,*r and*r was*r glad.*r
Then*p said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
Jesus*p said unto them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Before*r Abraham*r was,*r I*r am.*r
Then*p took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
